title: Best and Worst Apple Varieties by Texture and Taste

items.name: Red Delicious (worst)
items.details: Often considered the worst-tasting apple. Frequently criticized for being bland, mealy (dry, grainy, crumbly texture), and lacking flavor. More popular for appearance than taste.

items.name: Honeycrisp
items.details: Known for crispness and sweet-tart flavor. A favorite for eating fresh.

items.name: Granny Smith
items.details: Very crisp and tart green apple. Great for both eating and baking.

items.name: Fuji
items.details: Sweet and firm with a dense, crisp texture.

items.name: Gala
items.details: Sweet and mildly crisp. Popular choice for snacking.

items.name: Pink Lady
items.details: Firm texture with balanced sweet-tart flavor.

notes: 'Mealy' means a texture that feels dry, grainy, and crumbly rather than crisp and juicy. To avoid mealy apples, choose Honeycrisp, Granny Smith, Fuji, Gala, or Pink Lady.
